Class WController

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.client.wysiwyg.editor.WController
public class WController extends Object
WYSIWYG DMS Message Editor Controller for handling exchanges between the editor GUI form and the renderer.
Author:
Gordon Parikh - SRF Consulting

    • restoreLastGoodState

      public IAction restoreLastGoodState
      An action to restore the last good state of the editor (i.e. the last state that had no MULTI/renderer errors) in a way that can be redone. Lets the user to return to a good state if they are confused, while allowing them to step back through their changes to help them find the error to achieve whatever they wanted to do. Note that if there wasn't a good state, we're hosed. MULTI mode is the only way back in that case (perhaps we should display an message then??).

    • saveMessage

      public Action saveMessage
      Save the current MULTI string in the message pattern

    • saveMessageAs

      public Action saveMessageAs

      public Action editPageTimingAction

      public void init(WMsgEditorForm e)
      Perform some initialization on the controller. Sets the editor form handle, sets up the mouse cursor, etc.

      public void postInit()
      Initialize some things that need to take place after all elements of the editor are in place. Called by the WMsgEditorForm at the end of initialize().

      public void handleMouseReleased(MouseEvent e)
      Finalize any active drag motion.

    • addGraphic

      public void addGraphic(Graphic g)
      Add a graphic to the current page. The graphic will be added to (1, 1) (in sign coordinates), but it can be moved later.

    • findClosestTextToken

      public WToken findClosestTextToken(WPoint p)
      Find the closest token in the active text rectangle given a set of click coordinates.

    • moveCaret

      public void moveCaret(WPoint p)
      Move the caret given a mouse pointer coordinate indicated by the WPoint p.

    • moveCaret

      public void moveCaret(WToken tok)
      Move the caret to the spot just before the specified token. Note that this doesn't select the token.

    • moveCaret

      public void moveCaret(WToken tok, boolean toRight)
      Move the caret to the spot just after the specified token. Note that this doesn't select the token.

    • moveCaret

      public void moveCaret(int tokIndx)
      Move the caret to the spot just before the specified token index. Note that this does not select the token. If tokIndx is -1, the caret is moved to the end of the page.

    • updateCaret

      public void updateCaret()
      Update the caret location by moving it to the location defined by caretIndx and caretAtEnd.

    • getCaretToken

      public WToken getCaretToken()
      Get the token associated with the current caret position. This is either the first token after the caret or the last token before the caret, or null if neither is valid.

    • moveCaretUp

      public void moveCaretUp()
      Move caret up one line (using up arrow key)

    • moveCaretDown

      public void moveCaretDown()
      Move caret down one line (using up arrow key)

    • selectPrevRegion

      public void selectPrevRegion()
      Select the previous region in the region list for the current mode.

    • selectNextRegion

      public void selectNextRegion()
      Select the next region in the region list for the current mode.

    • typeChar

      public void typeChar(char c)
      Add a single ASCII character to the message at the caret location.

    • getPrecedingTokenOfType

      public WToken getPrecedingTokenOfType(WTokenType tokType)
      Get the last token of type tokType (i.e. closest token behind the caret). Used for for determining the active font/color/justification used to set the respective button on the toolbar. If one isn't found, null is returned (and the caller should use the default).

    • getTokensOfTypeInSelection

      public WTokenList getTokensOfTypeInSelection(WTokenType tokType)
      Get the list of tokens matching type tokType in the current selection. Used for determining the active font/color/justification used to set the respective buttons on the toolbar. If none are found, an empty list is returned.

    • getActiveFont

      public Integer getActiveFont()
      Get the active page font given the current caret location. Uses font tags in the preceding and/or selected tokens and the default to determine what the "active" font value is.

    • setFont

      public void setFont(Font f)
      Add a font tag at the current location.

    • setForegroundColor

      public void setForegroundColor(DmsColor c)
      Add a foreground color token at the current location.

    • setBackgroundColor

      public void setBackgroundColor(DmsColor c)
      Add a background color token at the beginning of the page. Uses a page background color tag and not the deprecated color background tag.

    • getMonochromeFromTag

      public DmsColor getMonochromeFromTag(Integer c)
      Get the DmsColor object given the monochrome color tag value c.

    • setColorRectangleColor

      public void setColorRectangleColor(DmsColor c)
      Set the color value of the currently selected color rectangle. Also sets the active color rectangle color so new ones created after this use the same color

    • setColorRectangleColor

      public void setColorRectangleColor(Integer c)
      Set the color value of the currently selected color rectangle. Also sets the active color rectangle color so new ones created after this use the same color. For monochrome color schemes.

    • getColorRectangleColor

      public DmsColor getColorRectangleColor()
      Return the current color for drawing color rectangles.

    • getActivePageJustification

      public Multi.JustificationPage getActivePageJustification()
      Get the active page justification value given the current caret location. Uses page justification tags in the preceding and/or selected tokens and the default to determine what the "active" page justification value is.

    • getActiveLineJustification

      public Multi.JustificationLine getActiveLineJustification()
      Get the active page justification value given the current caret location. Uses page justification tags in the preceding and/or selected tokens and the default to determine what the "active" page justification value is.

    • addToken

      public void addToken(WToken tok)
      Add the token to the selected page at the caret index.

    • replaceToken

      public void replaceToken(WToken oldTok, WToken newTok)
      Replace the token oldTok with token newTok. If the first token cannot be found, nothing happens (?).

    • saveState

      public void saveState()
      Save the current state on the stack for undoing. Resets the redo stack.

    • getPagePreviewList

      public WPageList getPagePreviewList()
      Return a WPageList with selection disabled for previewing a message

      Return this controller's WPageList which is used for selecting pages

    • updateMultiString

      public void updateMultiString()
      Update our current MULTI string, either from the WMessage (in WYSIWYG mode) or from the MULTI panel (if MULTI mode is forced).

      Return whether or not the current message text has been saved.
